snippet: Enrique Peña Nieto is favored to win the presidential election, even as he is associated with infidelity and former officials of his party are accused of corruption.
abstract: Enrique Pena Nieto remains the odds-on favorite to win Mexico's presidential election in July, despite the fact that his opponents have bombarded voters with negative publicity that would likely lead to an electoral defeat for any other candidate; separately, state assembly candidate Margarito Genchi is shot to death in the state of Guerrero.
lead_paragraph: Enrique Peña Nieto is favored to win the presidential election, even as he is associated with infidelity and former officials of his party are accused of corruption.

headline.main: In Mexico, a Candidate Stands Out Despite Attacks
headline.print_headline: In Mexico, a Candidate Stands Out Despite Attacks
